Package stockmarket.model

Contains the models that store mutable data values for this program.
IDEAS FOR MODELS:

SelectedStockModel - contains a reference to a Stock object that is currently selected, or null if there is no currently selected Stock.

ComponentsEnabledModel - tracks which components in the GUI are currently enabled.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Portfolio
    An interface defining the methods of a stock portfolio object.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractPropertyModel
    Abstract framework for a JavaBean bound property model.
    GUIStateModel
    A JavaBean bound property model that defines the current state of the GUI of the StockMarket program.
    PortfolioModel
    A JavaBean bound property model storing the values defining a stock portfolio in the StockMarket program.
    SQLPortfolioModel
    An extension of the standard PortfolioModel to integrate a field for a SQL userid primary key.
    StockDisplayModel
    A JavaBean bound property model defining the value of the stock currently being displayed in the program.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    InsufficientFundsException
    Exception that is thrown by when there is not enough funds available to make a transaction.

Package stockmarket.model Description

Contains the models that store mutable data values for this program.
IDEAS FOR MODELS:

SelectedStockModel - contains a reference to a Stock object that is currently selected, or null if there is no currently selected Stock.

ComponentsEnabledModel - tracks which components in the GUI are currently enabled. TODO Change the concept here slightly to be less about individual components, and more about a particular state of the program.

ChartModel - this is tied in some way to the models in JFreeChart that need to be used for the model. Also, gotta have the timeframe in here some way.

FindFieldModel - this controls the find field's state. Whether the button or the field is visible. NetModel - cash balance, net worth, gains/losses TODO think about adding models for the buy/sell dialogs as well.
Since:
Version 2.0
Author:
Craig
